content.description: This route is at the left side of the cave.  Clip the first bolt, move out left, and then up through a roof and to the anchor.
content.location:
Start at the left side of the cave, just left of

The Grip

.

content.description:
Located in the Country Club Cave, this route clips the two double draws hanging in the cave.

Start on

Divitator

and head left after the first double draw and clip through the next double and head up and back to

Divitator's

anchors.

Do

Masters Leftover

, but bust right at the top to a separate anchor.  This is a bit harder and sharper than

Master's Leftover

with a tough anchor clip. It is much fun.
content.location:
Start skier's left of

Master's Leftover

.

content.description: Master's Leftover climbs along the left lip of the cave for a few bolts before heading straight up to the top of the wall. Be ready for steep rock, good holds, and huge moves. It's one of the longer routes up here and pretty pumpy.
content.location: On the left side of the Country Club Cave, climb straight up, then right, then up again. It has fixed chain draws.

content.description:
Start on

Divitator

, clipping the first bolt, and immediately head right on huge pockets and holes to eventually finish on

Bogey Man

.

This route is in the Country Club Cave and clips through the two double draws and heads left to different black bolts and anchors than

Divitator

and

Pink Taco

.  Start on

Divitator

, clip though both double draws staying low in two thin pockets and finishing with the final gaston boulder problem of

Bitches Get Stitches

.  Some say this is contrived but I'm pretty sure it's the original Left Hazard before the higher variation (

Left High

) was discovered.

This is the high variation of

Left Hazard Low

.  Climb through the

Divitator

and

Pink Taco

cruxes. When you reach the jug pocket at the end of the

Pink Taco

crux, launch up and left into a final boulder problem guarding a right-facing, jug flake. From there, a few easy moves will have you at the Left Hazard/

Bitchez Git Stitchez

anchors.
Starts just right of Rain Delay. Clip the first bolt, and then move up and right to the roof then straight up to the anchor.
content.location:
Start on the left side of the cave, just right of

Rain Delay

.

content.description: This route starts steep with undercut feet then eases back up to the chains.  It is a descent warm-up route.
content.location:
It is just to the right of the Country Club Cave and just to the right of

Birdie

.

content.description: This is one of the three main routes in the cave.  You can find it by a couple of double draws hanging in the cave.  Divitator clips only the first double draw and heads straight up from there.
content.protection: There are usually draws on it from people projecting it, all but the first bolt.  So, one or five quickdraws.

content.description: A steep start leads to a high first bolt and then a crux section.  Above this is less steep and easier climbing to the anchor.
content.location:
This is towards the right side of the cave.  It is the first route to the left of

Birdie

.

content.description:
This is kind of a weiwd wink-up of a few wock cwimbs in the 'Countwy Cwub Cave'.  Stawt on Bogeyman and go to skiur's wight (cwimbur's weft) aftur the furst bowt, and then cwip the vewy wast bowt of 'The Winks' (aka 'The Links').  Fwom there, go up and swightwy weft (skiur's wight) to the next bowt on 'Chip Shot', and then finish on '

Divitator

' (or any of that cwuster of woutes incwuding '

Pink Taco

' and '

Weft Hazzard

').
content.protection: Onwy one wong dwaw for the bowt on 'Chip Shot.'

content.description:
This line was bolted and cleaned by Marcus Garcia, Timmy Tormmy, and myself. (I don't know why a 35 foot route took three people to bolt? I guess we were to busy slapping each other's asses). None of us could woo this sassy little frassy for over a year (also because we were to busy slapping each other's asses). It took the suave and cultured hands of local stud muffin, Evan Blare (sorry girls, he's taken), to unlock the chastity belt and de-flower this sexy little thing! LIKE A BAWS.

If you want beta and shit, sack up and climb it yourself!
content.protection: Rusted old boltz that will rip and you will die, or something like that.
content.location: Clip first bolt on Diviturded, then go left. If your hands start disappearing behind gigantor buckets, you're an idiot and you're on Diviturded. Lower to the ground, have your belayer kick you in the ass and try again. That is all.

content.description:
This is the direct start to

Bitchez Get Stitchez

. It gets three stars for the movement and fun factor, only one for rock quality, unfortunately. This route is a great challenge despite its lack of aesthetic appeal. Fun and very difficult moves lead out a horizontal roof to meet up with the redpoint crux of

Bitchez Get Stitchez

.
content.location:
Start 10ish feet to the left of

Bitchez Get Stitchez

. Do your best to avoid the awful choss that lurks just to the left.

content.description:
Start with a bouldery little crux on some fun flowstone, and then get a rest before entering the crimpy crux of

Bachelor Party

.
content.protection: Chalk, harness, rope, belay device, crash pad, helmet, kneepad, hand jammies, etc.
content.location:
This route is second from the left and joins

Bachelor Party

at the 4th bolt.

content.description:
This is one of the easier climbs at the Golf Wall. It is a good, pumpy warmup for the other steep routes.

Start on the right edge of the Country Club Cave for a few steep, finger crack, layback-like moves to the first bolt. Then traverse a bit right, and reach back for the clip. Do a crux move, then climb mostly straight up to a pretty good rest on the ledge before the pumpy headwall finish.
content.location: This begins on right edge of the Country Club Cave.

content.description: Start left, then continue moving right over the first three bolts then into the thin crux area protected by two fixed draws.  Continue straight up over a roof with big holds to the anchor.
content.location:
Left of

Rain Delay

, this is the first route encountered heading to the cave area.
On the left side of the cave. Just right of 'The Grip'.  Shared start with 'Masters Leftover' and 'Masters Left-Right' then go straight up.
